p.seg: Gou Lao asked Peng Zu:
“The Guo Shi state holds a heart that is not reckless,
and therefore receives the mandate for a perpetual duration.
Which method should I enact,
to be able to change myself,
and to be attentive to the imperial rules?”
Peng Zu said:
“Pause!
You will have to ask more about the (basic) reasons and causes,
and only then you will not lose the norms.
That norm of Heaven,
it is permanent [...]
I do not know where it ends.
Gou Lao said:
“Dull me Zhen Zi (?),
I am not yet able to conform to Heaven,
may I ask how to behave as a man?”
Peng Zu said [...]
(Peng Zu) said:
“Heaven and Earth in relationship with man,
is like warp and weft,
like the outside and inside of a dress.”
He asked:
“Of these three we could leave out the (first) two (namely Heaven and Earth),
what about stopping (at man)?”
Peng Zu said:
“Ah, how diligent and pressing is your asking.
I will tell you about the rules for men, namely:
Guard yourself against being arrogant,
be cautious until the end and keep toiling,
be attentive in great plans,
consider difficult what is deemed easy
and stop your desires.
(this is what) I (wanted to) tell you.
[...] father son, elder and younger brother.
When the five norms are entire and complete,
even if one is poor he will be necessarily accomplished,
when the five norms are not done skillfully,
even if one is rich he will be necessarily lacking.
I will tell you what a calamity is [...]
[...] that plan cannot be enacted,
an apprehensive heart cannot thrive,
keep afar anxious thoughts,
use your plain nature,
in your heart be candid,
in your person relaxed.
I will tell you what is wickedness [...]
[...] it reaches (up) to Heaven
and it plunges down into the depths,
your virtue has risen high,
how exalted it is!
Therefore your will is good [...]
[...] is not cheerful,
who has too many occupations has many worries,
who injures (others) injures oneself.
Peng Zu said:
To look down respectfully (?) at the first command,
this is called increment (of virtue);
to look down respectfully three times at the first command,
this is called to increase (virtue) on one’s own;
to look down respectfully many times at the third time you have received a command,
this is what is called a leader of the people.
To look up defiantly at the first command,
this is called to meet with disaster;
to look up defiantly three times at the first command,
this is called not to last long;
to look up defiantly many times at the third time you have received a command,
this is what is called to be cut off and finish (one’s life).
Do not pursue riches,
do not boast about your worthiness,
do not exalt your own contributions.
